sentence:
Mr. CARTER of Texas. Mr Speaker, I am proud to honor Commander Jon  Lux, U.S. Navy, Retired, with a Congressional Veteran Commendation.  Commander Lux's commitment, strength, and leadership reflects the very  best of Texas.

Commander Lux's distinguished naval career spanned over 2 decades.…

Mr. SESSIONS. Mr. Speaker, I rise today to honor Danny Charles Masur,  of Rockdale, Texas, by presenting him with a Congressional Veteran  Commendation. His persistent efforts in fostering beliefs of sacrifice  and respect reflect his value as a leader during service and in  retirement.

Mr. SESSIONS. Mr. Speaker, I am honored to present Nola Jane Saldana  of Waco, Texas, with a Congressional Veteran Commendation. Nola Saldana  is a proud United States Navy veteran, who served nearly 10 years and  continues to dedicate her life to supporting veterans and her  community.…

Mr. SESSIONS. Mr. Speaker, I rise today to recognize and honor Delman  Leon Orme of Crockett, Texas, as a distinguished recipient of the  Congressional Veteran Commendation. His servant's life reflects the  hard work and dedication that exemplifies the best of our Nation's  values.

Mr. SESSIONS. Mr. Speaker, I am honored to present retired USA  Lieutenant Colonel William (Bill) Patterson Matthews, of Mexia, Texas,  with a Congressional Veteran Commendation in recognition of his  outstanding service to both his country and his community.

Mr. CARTER of Texas. Mr. Speaker, it is with great pride and honor  that I present Lieutenant Colonel Spencer Hutson Smith, U.S. Marine  Corps (Ret.), with a Congressional Veteran Commendation. His life and  career are a testament to his exceptional character and unwavering  commitment to service.

Mr. CARTER of Texas. Mr. Speaker, I am proud to salute the  extraordinary career of Major General Patrick Hamilton, U.S. Army,  Retired, with a Congressional Veteran Commendation. His service to both  the Army and  his Nation exemplifies our Nation's altruistic spirit.

Mr. SESSIONS. Mr. Speaker, I am honored to present retired USAF  Technical Sergeant Martha Socorro Ybarra of Waco, Texas, with a  Congressional Veteran Commendation. Her 20-year service to our country  followed by her heavily involved community service is a template for  American Exceptionalism.
